title: Manchester City can't win the Champions League with current defence says Steven Gerrard
text:
Manchester City can't win the Champions League with current defence says Steven Gerrard The Liverpool legend said he feels sorry for Pep Guardiola's back-line for being forced to play out Share Steven Gerrard doesn't believe Manchester City can win the Champions League with their current defence (Photo: BT Sport) Share Get daily   Thank you for subscribing! Could   
Manchester City left fans salivating with their attacking display against Monaco, but their obvious defensive frailties have Steven Gerrard convinced they won't win the Champions League. 
Pep Guardiola's side came from 2-1 and 3-2 down at home to beat the Ligue 1 leaders 5-3, but made a number of individual and collective errors at the back in a thrilling contest in Manchester. 
And Gerrard admitted that with their current personnel at the back he can't see City lifting the trophy in Cardiff in June. Monaco's Radamel Falcao scores his sides third while Nicolas Otamendi and Bacary Sagna look on (Photo: PA) Monaco's Kylian Mbappe also took advantage of poor city defending (Photo: REUTERS) 
"I don’t think they can at the top end," said the Liverpool legend, when asked if Pep Guardiola could win major trophies with his current defence. 
"I think you’ll get away with it against most teams or three quarters of the teams in the Premier League but at the top end of the Champions League that defence won’t go on to win it in my opinion. Sagna talks to teammate John Stones (Photo: AFP/Getty Images) 
"You almost feel sorry for City’s defenders in a way because you can see that the manger is saying to them ‘you have to play out’ and it’s almost like suicide football, so, the defenders are under pressure straight from the beginning. 
"You almost feel sorry for them in a way and I think the manager at some stage has got to take a bit of heat off them and go long at times." poll loading Can Manchester City win the Champions League? 0+ VOTES SO FAR
